powder_types: unspecified powder from devil (claimed thrown away)

testimony.threat_quote: Il en a assez pour toute sa vie (or pour longtemps)

testimony.threat_quote: escoute tu pourrois bien avoir quelque chose qui ne te sera pas bon et que tu gardera longtemps

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: since Barbon touched her on back

timeline.subject: Nicolas Moictrier
timeline.details: Husband's complaint made on behalf of wife for 'exces et delicts'

timeline.subject: Nicolas Rémy
timeline.details: Procureur Général replies case cannot be held over but proceedings may be taken against Barbon

timeline.subject: Mayor of St Nicolas
timeline.details: Mayor agrees to taking of depositions in response to Pierre Clement

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Clerc juré says Pierre Clement has produced witness list; Nicolas Moictrier's procureur claimed nullity

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Court at St Nicolas arrests Barbon following Rémy's order from previous day

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Confrontations continued; additional witness Yzabillon produced

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; lasted 2 hours with thumbscrews and rack

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Rémy suggests she be tortured again; second interrogation with additional confessions

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Rémy asks for execution, after confrontation with 'la belle Agnes'

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees, specifying she should be strangled once she had felt the fire

timeline.subject: Barbon Moictrier
timeline.details: Court at St Nicolas issues definitive death sentence

accomplices_named.name: la belle Agnes
accomplices_named.context: Named during torture confession as being at sabbat, described as 'des plus avancés en credit et a la danse'

prior_accusations.context: General reputation at Haraucourt going back 13-14 years

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolle femme Mengin Jacquot
notable_quotes.french: bien bien avant qu'il soit peu de temps tu en acheptera du bien cher
notable_quotes.english: Well well, before long you will buy it much more dearly
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel about milk price

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbon Moictrier
notable_quotes.french: combien que c'est la premiere injure que l'on faict presentement aux vieilles femmes
notable_quotes.english: although this is the first insult one gives nowadays to old women
notable_quotes.context: Response to being called witch during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbon Moictrier
notable_quotes.french: faictes moy mourir pour l'honneur de dieu, menez moy au poicteau et me faictes brusler je suis femme de bien
notable_quotes.english: Make me die for the honor of God, take me to the stake and burn me, I am a good woman

notable_quotes.speaker: Denise femme Demenge Mathis
notable_quotes.french: ouy je suis genaixe et tu es ung larron
notable_quotes.english: Yes I am troublesome and you are a thief
notable_quotes.context: Barbon's response when son-in-law called her witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Poirson Poirat
notable_quotes.french: eh bien, tu ne me veux pas vendre ton porcq tu n'en gagneras rien
notable_quotes.english: Well then, you don't want to sell me your pig, you will gain nothing from it

notable_quotes.speaker: Martin Humbert
notable_quotes.french: O sorciere, il y a longtemps que tu debvrois estre bruslée est tu encor au monde
notable_quotes.english: Oh witch, it's been a long time since you should have been burned, are you still in the world

notable_quotes.speaker: Hellenix femme Martin Humbert
notable_quotes.french: Hellenix votre marit me veut grand mal que sy ne le peut escorcher je luy feray garder le lict longtemps en mal santé
notable_quotes.english: Hellenix your husband wishes me great harm, if he cannot flay me I will make him keep to bed for a long time in ill health
notable_quotes.context: Threat to witness about her husband

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbon Moictrier
notable_quotes.french: de ne se laisser tourmenter rompre et briser a la force de la gehenne, pour craincte d'aucung danger de sa vie qu'elle puisse s'en proposer
notable_quotes.english: not to let herself be tormented, broken and shattered by the force of torture, for fear of any danger to her life that she might consider

relationships.evidence_text: wife of Nicolas Moictrier manouvrier of St Nicolas
First husband was Nicolas Vepye (?), manouvrier of Haraucourt, with whom she lived for 48 years until his death
Was daughter of Vergonne Hermenal of Varangeville
daughter of Vergonne Hermenal of Varangeville and his wife Comtesse
Barbon, her sister-in-law (mentioned by wife of Petit Didier)
her daughter Barbon, wife of Noel Laurent (?) of Haraucourt
wife of his brother Gergin Humbert
Claudon femme Laurent Bassin de Haraucourt
Anne femme Claudin Caulies de Haraucourt
Claudon femme Mengin Collesson de Haraucourt
Collatte femme Jean Gerard de St Nicolas
Yolant femme Jean Jacques paticier de St Nicolas
Marguerite femme Nicolas Bigly de St Nicolas

relationships.person1: Yzabel (daughter of Barbon from first marriage)

relationships.evidence_text: Pierre Clement of St Nicolas formal accuser; wife bought land near Barbon

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over small economic transactions: milk payment, salt underpayment, straw purchases, land boundary dispute. Barbon accused of allowing stepdaughter to steal her linen and money. Economic transactions frequently precipitated quarrels leading to accusations.

prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Rémy said case could not be held over but proceedings could be taken against Barbon

prior_legal_disputes.description: Barbon complained to Jean Perrin (lieutenant to mayor) about being called witch
Husband and chambermaid of Pierre Clement beat Barbon, threw her on fire, saying they did so in name of comte de Salm
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Unknown; Barbon showed wounds still visible

legal_context.redress_outcome: Unknown - complained to Jean Perrin about being called witch

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Should be strangled once she had felt the fire (rather than being strangled before fire)

hearsay_chains.content: Said those of Harracourt knew well she was witch but would not name who or why

hearsay_chains.content: Told by her that Barbon said of his illness 'Il en at pour sa vie'
Daughter said Barbon might have given her illness because she touched her
Heard parents say Barbon had given illness to brother

hearsay_chains.content: Should hear about powder on grass causing cows to die
Barbon came to mill bruised, said brother-in-law beat her

emotional_state_notes: jumped up and tried to strangle Poirson Poirat during confrontation
said she was willing to die but not confess untruths
after torture said 'make me die for honor of God, I am femme de bien'

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Wife Catherine was a thief, only good to steal grain
He was a thief of turnips and cutter of grain stalks
Denied friendship; said she had been called witch and retreated into house
Wife of accuser gave witnesses lard and drink to testify
He was a liar; his child died of plague; called him 'meschant larron'
He was a thief, on 'papier rouge' for stealing watches
She was 'faulsaire et fille de faux dismeur'
He lied, horses died of natural causes; if he had given her what she asked he wouldn't have testified
If she were 'femme de bien' she wouldn't have abandoned her children to go to the priest
She had not caused illness; they had burned and beaten her to force confession

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally detailed trial record with 38 witnesses and extensive confrontations. Key uncertainties: (1) Some names are unclear in original document, marked with (?). (2) Barbon's practiced healing is clearly evidenced - she offered remedies, sent lard with instructions, prescribed baths, suggested picquatte, offered to cure at night - though she denied this during interrogation. (3) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: only had 9-10 francs, towel and sheet left; engaged in petty economic transactions (selling milk, doing spinning); quarrels over very small sums. (4) The confession under torture contains claims not corroborated by witness testimony (killing 4 children, specific numbers of animals) and should be treated with caution. (5) Torture confession was retracted and renewed multiple times. (6) The violent attack by Pierre Clement's household (beating and burning Barbon) is significant context for understanding the formal accusation. (7) Strong evidence of reputation going back 13-14 years at Haraucourt. (8) Language region is French - Saint Nicolas is in French-speaking Lorraine. (9) The Change de Nancy's modification requiring she 'feel the fire' before strangling is a notable detail about execution method. (10) 'Partie formelle' (formal accuser) is Pierre Clement who initiated the trial request, though the trial evolved from his initial complaint.
